intro: Galium hilendiae, commonly known as the Hilendia bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to South America, specifically found in Brazil. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, herbaceous stems and small, opposite leaves. It produces clusters of tiny, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Galium hilendiae is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and stream sides.
